00:00:00:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:00:020000.Dialogue: So you see, what you're eating is not technically yogurt, because it doesn't have enough live acidophilus cultures. It's really just ice milk with carrageenan added for thickness.

00:00:10:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:10:160000.Dialogue: It's also not pink and has no berries.

00:00:14:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:14:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, but it doesn't really answer my question.

00:00:50:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:50:210000.Dialogue: Why don't we just go into, your...

00:00:54:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:54:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, you know what, maybe we should slow things down a little.

00:00:56:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:56:220000.Dialogue: I didn't mean to go into your apartment to... - go fast.

00:01:01:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:01:170000.Dialogue: I know what you meant, it's just... this is only our first date.

00:01:04:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:04:190000.Dialogue: Okay, sure, no problem. Why don't we just figure out where we're going and when we want to get there, and then rate of speed equals distance over time.

00:01:19:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:19:150000.Dialogue: Or we could just wing it.

00:01:39:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:39:020000.Dialogue: Hey, Leonard. How was your date?

00:01:45:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:45:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, how could you just sit there and let them spy on me?

00:01:49:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:49:020000.Dialogue: They were clever. They exploited my complete lack of interest in what you were doing.

00:01:54:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:54:230000.Dialogue: You should thank us. When future generations try to determine why your relationship with Penny crashed and burned, this right here is the black box.

00:02:04:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:04:080000.Dialogue: What are you talking about? The date went fine.

00:02:06:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:06:230000.Dialogue: She said she wants to slow things down.

00:02:08:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:08:230000.Dialogue: Okay, so she said she wants to slow things down. It's like saying, I'm really enjoying this meal. I'm going to slow down and savor it.

00:02:18:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:18:210000.Dialogue: No, it's like, This fish tastes bad,

00:02:23:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:23:030000.Dialogue: so I'm gonna slow down and spit it out.

00:02:30:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:30:060000.Dialogue: Really? Did you make a second date?

00:02:32:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:32:110000.Dialogue: No, we sort of decided to wing it.

00:02:37:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:37:220000.Dialogue: Okay, all right, let's assume your hypothesis. We went to dinner, we talked, we laughed, we kissed. Where could I have possibly gone wrong?

00:02:46:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:46:090000.Dialogue: Think back, Leonard. The littlest things can set women off. Like, Hey, the waitress is hot, I bet we could get her to come home with us.

00:02:54:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:54:030000.Dialogue: Or, How much does your mom weigh? I want to know what I'm getting into.

00:02:58:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:58:060000.Dialogue: - I didn't say anything like that.

00:03:02:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:02:130000.Dialogue: They also don't care for it if you stare at them and hyperventilate. Sadly, that's my home run swing.

00:03:08:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:08:100000.Dialogue: Look, everything went fine. I didn't even have to refer to my impromptu conversation starters. That woman across the hall is into me.

00:03:21:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:21:130000.Dialogue: Look at her reaction to the good night kiss. No change in respiration, pupils un-dilated, - no flushing of the chest.

00:03:30:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:30:180000.Dialogue: Interesting. Her jaws are clenched: no tongue access. Clearly a bad sign amongst mating humans.

00:03:39:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:39:150000.Dialogue: Please, you might as well have been two iguana with no dewlap enlargement.

00:03:44:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:44:030000.Dialogue: And the worst sign of all is you're here and not there.

00:03:46:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:46:220000.Dialogue: I'm not there because I'm taking things slow, which, by the way, compared to you guys, approaches warp speed.

00:03:59:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:59:190000.Dialogue: He was a lot more fun when he had no hope.

00:04:39:030000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:04:39:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:40:060000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:04:40:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:40:060000.Dialogue: Oh, hi, Penny. FYI, the hot water is inadequate on machine two, so colors only, and four is still releasing the fabric softener too early in the cycle, - so avoid using it for your delicates.

00:04:48:150000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:04:48:150000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:54:210000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:04:54:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:54:210000.Dialogue: Good Lord... why don't you just take your clothes down to the river and beat them with a rock?

00:05:06:060000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:06:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:06:060000.Dialogue: Can I ask you a question?

00:05:07:200000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:07:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:07:200000.Dialogue: I would prefer that you not, but I won't go so far as to forbid it.

00:05:12:110000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:12:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:12:110000.Dialogue: All right, I heard yes, so... Here's my question. Has Leonard ever dated, you know, a regular girl?

00:05:23:020000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:23:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:23:020000.Dialogue: I assume you're not referring to digestive regularity.

00:05:27:140000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:27:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:27:140000.Dialogue: Because I've come to learn that such inquiries are inappropriate.

00:05:31:190000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:31:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:31:190000.Dialogue: No, I meant, has he ever been involved with someone who wasn't a brainiac?

00:05:38:080000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:38:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:38:080000.Dialogue: A few years ago, he did go out with a woman who had a PhD in French literature.

00:05:44:040000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:44:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:44:040000.Dialogue: How is that not a brainiac?

00:05:46:060000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:46:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:46:060000.Dialogue: Well, for one thing, she was French.

00:05:50:190000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:50:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:59:100000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:05:59:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:59:100000.Dialogue: So... Do you think that if Leonard and I keep dating, he'll eventually get bored with me?

00:06:13:010000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:13:010000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:15:160000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:15:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:15:160000.Dialogue: Do you have a working knowledge of quantum physics?

00:06:19:140000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:19:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:19:140000.Dialogue: Do you speak Klingon? - You know any card tricks?

00:06:23:160000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:23:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:28:120000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:28:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:28:120000.Dialogue: I get it. Leonard has no business being involved with a waitress-slash-actress who felt so insecure that she lied to him about finishing community college.

00:06:37:060000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:37:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:37:060000.Dialogue: Why would you lie about that?

00:06:38:230000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:38:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:38:230000.Dialogue: He was going on and on about this college and that grad school, I didn't want him to think I was some kind of stupid loser.

00:06:45:150000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:45:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:45:150000.Dialogue: You thought the opposite of stupid loser was community college graduate?

00:06:54:190000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:54:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:54:190000.Dialogue: You know, there are a lot of successful people in this country who are community college graduates.

00:06:59:120000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:06:59:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:03:120000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:07:03:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:03:120000.Dialogue: Right. Okay, this is between you and me. You cannot tell Leonard any of this.

00:07:10:070000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:07:10:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:10:070000.Dialogue: You're asking me to keep a secret? Well, I'm sorry, but you would have had to express that desire before revealing the secret, so I could've chosen if I wanted to accept the covenant of secret keeping.

00:07:22:190000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:07:22:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:22:190000.Dialogue: You can't impose a secret on an ex post facto basis.

00:07:27:140000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:07:27:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:07:29:080000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:07:29:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:29:080000.Dialogue: Secret keeping is a complicated endeavor. One has to be concerned not only about what one says, but about facial expressions, autonomic reflexes. When I try to deceive, I myself have more nervous tics than a Lyme disease research facility.

00:07:48:220000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:07:48:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:48:220000.Dialogue: It's a joke. It relies on the homonymic relationship between tick, the bloodsucking arachnid, and tic, the involuntary muscular contraction.

00:08:01:020000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:08:01:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:05:060000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:08:05:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:05:060000.Dialogue: Okay, look, if Leonard finds out that I lied, I will absolutely die of embarrassment.

00:08:10:060000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:08:10:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:16:190000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:08:16:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:16:190000.Dialogue: So you're saying that friendship contains within it an inherent obligation to maintain confidences?

00:08:22:010000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:08:22:010000.Speaker: Penny

00:08:23:140000.Scene: The laundry room. Sheldon is folding shirts.
00:08:23:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:23:140000.Dialogue: Interesting. One more question, and perhaps I should have led with this. When did we become friends?

00:08:33:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:33:020000.Dialogue: ... i.e., I couldn't become Green Lantern unless I was chosen by the Guardians of Oa, but given enough start-up capital and an adequate research facility, I could be Batman.

00:08:56:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:56:220000.Dialogue: If you're free Friday night, I thought maybe we could go see a movie.

00:09:00:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:00:140000.Dialogue: Oh, you know, I think I have the dinner shift on Friday.

00:09:05:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:05:040000.Dialogue: I'm not sure; the manager hasn't posted the schedule yet. - How about I let you know?

00:09:08:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:08:100000.Dialogue: - Great. So you just let me know when you know. Okay, so... Oh, God, I am the bad fish.

00:09:19:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:19:160000.Dialogue: Why are you asking me? I have no information about your interactions with Penny other than what you have provided me, nor do I have any method of learning such things.

00:09:38:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:38:170000.Dialogue: I just think you need to be careful how you phrase things, sir.

00:10:06:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:06:130000.Dialogue: There's no reason to bring my looks into this.

00:10:21:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:21:220000.Dialogue: Also today, we have a fresh-caught Alaska salmon, and that's served with a teriyaki glaze and sticky rice. - Our soup of the day is...

00:10:27:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:27:010000.Dialogue: - You must release me from my oath.

00:10:35:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:35:110000.Dialogue: - Why don't you take a minute to decide?

00:10:39:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:39:150000.Dialogue: I can't keep your secret. I'm going to fold like an energy-based de novo protein in conformational space.

00:10:46:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:46:230000.Dialogue: Like a Renaissance tryptich. Like a cheap suit.

00:10:51:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:51:110000.Dialogue: Look, why is it so hard for you to keep one little secret?

00:10:54:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:54:140000.Dialogue: I'm constitutionally incapable. That's why I was refused clearance for a prestigious government research fellowship at a secret military supercollider located beneath a fake agricultural station 12.5 miles southeast of Traverse City, Michigan.

00:11:11:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:11:200000.Dialogue: Which you did not hear about from me.

00:11:16:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:16:020000.Dialogue: Just forget I told you about me... - not graduating from community college.

00:11:18:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:18:110000.Dialogue: - Forget? You want me to forget? This mind does not forget. I haven't forgotten a single thing since my mother stopped breastfeeding me.

00:11:30:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:30:010000.Dialogue: - Okay... You promised me you would keep my secret, so just figure out a way to do it.

00:11:42:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:42:160000.Dialogue: What do you mean, you're moving out? Why?

00:11:45:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:45:020000.Dialogue: There doesn't have to be a reason.

00:11:50:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:50:170000.Dialogue: Not necessarily. This is a classic example of Munchausen's Trilemma. Either the reason is predicated on a series of sub-reasons leading to an infinite regression, or it tracks back to arbitrary axiomatic statements, or it's ultimately circular, i.e. I'm moving out because I'm moving out.

00:12:09:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:09:080000.Dialogue: Leonard, I don't see how I could have made it any simpler.

00:12:17:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:17:040000.Dialogue: We just got back from that exhibit of those plasticized human cadavers.

00:12:20:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:20:030000.Dialogue: And some of those skinless chicks were hot!

00:12:24:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:24:140000.Dialogue: If you'll excuse me, I'm going to pack.

00:12:28:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:28:090000.Dialogue: That's kind of an overreaction to a little harmless necrophilia.

00:12:34:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:34:040000.Dialogue: It's not you, Howard. He says he's moving out.

00:12:39:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:39:070000.Dialogue: Did you change the contrast or brightness settings on the TV? Did you take a Band-Aid off in front of him?

00:12:47:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:47:130000.Dialogue: Did you buy generic ketchup, forget to rinse the sink, talk to him through the bathroom door?

00:12:53:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:53:110000.Dialogue: Adjust the thermostat, cook with cilantro, pronounce the t in often?

00:13:00:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:00:220000.Dialogue: Did you make fun of trains?

00:13:05:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:05:060000.Dialogue: No, I didn't do anything. He's just gone insane.

00:13:08:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:08:200000.Dialogue: We all knew this day was coming.

00:13:14:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:14:180000.Dialogue: It's my pre-packed disaster evacuation bag.

00:13:18:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:18:200000.Dialogue: It's recommended by the Department of Homeland Security.

00:13:25:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:25:030000.Dialogue: Where are you going to live?

00:13:26:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:26:190000.Dialogue: Until I find a permanent place, I will stay with friends.

00:13:35:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:35:000000.Dialogue: You can't stay with me. I have a teeny-tiny apartment.

00:13:38:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:38:170000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but isn't hosting guests an aspect of manushya yajna, one of the five central religious duties or sacrifices of the Hindu householder?

00:13:58:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:58:120000.Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous, you love trains.

00:14:26:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:26:050000.Dialogue: This is a very old building.

00:14:28:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:28:110000.Dialogue: 60 years. It used to be a watch factory. What?

00:14:33:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:33:060000.Dialogue: Don't you worry about the residual radium from the luminous dials?

00:14:40:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:40:180000.Dialogue: I can't believe I didn't bring my Geiger counter.

00:14:44:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:44:060000.Dialogue: I had it on my bed and I didn't pack it.

00:14:52:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:52:020000.Dialogue: It was a joke. I was subverting the conversational expectations. I believe they call that the... ol' switcheroo.

00:15:08:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:08:090000.Dialogue: Yes, isn't she an amazing actress?

00:15:10:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:10:070000.Dialogue: Actually, I'd say she's a poor man's Madhuri Dixit.

00:15:14:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:14:000000.Dialogue: How dare you! Aishwarya Rai is a goddess. By comparison, Madhuri Dixit is a leprous prostitute.

00:15:24:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:24:090000.Dialogue: Sorry, I didn't mean to offend you. Obviously, you're not that familiar with Indian cinema.

00:15:50:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:50:090000.Dialogue: Shouldn't you put him in a brown paper bag and set him on fire?!

00:15:57:000000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:15:57:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:57:000000.Dialogue: I've never slept on an air mattress before.

00:16:00:190000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:00:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:04:040000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:04:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:04:040000.Dialogue: Maybe you'd be happier on a park bench.

00:16:08:150000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:08:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:08:150000.Dialogue: I don't see any way to get a park bench in here.

00:16:12:050000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:12:050000.Speaker: Howard

00:16:20:190000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:20:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:20:190000.Dialogue: - Get out of bed. We're switching.

00:16:23:120000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:23:120000.Speaker: Howard

00:16:25:100000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:25:100000.Speaker: Howard’s mother

00:16:27:100000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:27:100000.Speaker: Howard's mother (off)

00:16:31:120000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:31:120000.Speaker: Howard

00:16:33:160000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:33:160000.Speaker: Howard's mother
00:16:33:160000.Dialogue: If you don't settle down right now, I'm not going to let you have any more sleepovers!

00:16:41:020000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:41:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:41:020000.Dialogue: For God's sake, Ma, I'm 27 years old! And it's not even a school night!

00:16:51:230000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:51:230000.Speaker: Howard

00:16:59:030000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:16:59:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:59:030000.Dialogue: That poster of Halle Berry is a little unnerving.

00:17:03:180000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:03:180000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:05:150000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:05:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:05:150000.Dialogue: She's like my fourth favorite Catwoman.

00:17:07:220000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:07:220000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:09:010000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:09:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:09:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt, and then her.

00:17:12:130000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:12:130000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:14:060000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:14:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:17:010000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:17:010000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:19:220000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:19:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:19:220000.Dialogue: That makes Halle Berry my fifth favorite Catwoman. It's Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, - Eartha Kitt, Lee Merriweather...

00:17:24:220000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:24:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:24:220000.Dialogue: - Please, I'm begging you. Go to sleep.

00:17:28:150000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:36:010000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:36:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:36:010000.Dialogue: She did make a fine mutant in the X-Men movies, though.

00:17:38:170000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:38:170000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:51:040000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is in bed, Sheldon is on a blow up mattress on the floor.
00:17:51:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:51:040000.Dialogue: Professor X, Nightcrawler, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, Storm, Angel...

00:17:56:190000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:17:56:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:02:040000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:02:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:02:040000.Dialogue: There he is. There my old buddy bud bud.

00:18:11:170000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:11:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:12:230000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:12:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:12:230000.Dialogue: Koothrappali dumped him on me, and he couldn't get to sleep, so I gave him a glass of warm milk with a handful of my mom's Valium in it...

00:18:21:200000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:21:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:21:200000.Dialogue: but he still wouldn't shut up, so tag, you're it.

00:18:29:000000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:29:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:32:050000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:32:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:32:050000.Dialogue: - I still don't know why you left.

00:18:35:100000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:35:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:36:160000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:36:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:39:180000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:39:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:41:110000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:41:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:41:110000.Dialogue: I wouldn't tell you the secret.

00:18:47:220000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:47:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:47:220000.Dialogue: What secret? Tell me the secret.

00:18:54:050000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:54:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:58:180000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:18:58:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:58:180000.Dialogue: Jesus is okay with it but we can't tell Dad.

00:19:04:100000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:04:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:04:100000.Dialogue: Not that secret. The other secret.

00:19:07:000000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:07:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:13:150000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:13:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:13:150000.Dialogue: You said Penny told you a secret. What's the secret?

00:19:17:060000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:17:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:17:060000.Dialogue: Okay, I'll tell you, but you can't tell Leonard.

00:19:22:050000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:22:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:19:24:110000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:24:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:24:110000.Dialogue: Penny lied about graduating from community college 'cause she's afraid she's not smart enough for Leonard.

00:19:34:180000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:34:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:34:180000.Dialogue: So it's nothing I did? It's her problem?

00:19:38:040000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:38:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:38:040000.Dialogue: I drank milk that tasted funny.

00:19:44:210000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:44:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:44:210000.Dialogue: Penny thinks I'm too smart for her. That's ridiculous.

00:19:48:010000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:48:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:50:180000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:50:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:50:180000.Dialogue: Most of your work is extremely derivative.

00:19:54:070000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. There is an urgent rapping at the door.
00:19:54:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:54:070000.Dialogue: And don't worry, that's not a secret. Everybody knows.

00:20:04:080000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:04:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:08:220000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:08:220000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:10:110000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:10:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:10:110000.Dialogue: First, I wanna say that it's not Sheldon's fault. He tried very hard to keep your secret. If Howard hadn't drugged him, he would've taken it to his grave.

00:20:18:150000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:18:150000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:21:040000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:21:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:21:040000.Dialogue: Now that we know what the problem is there's a simple solution.

00:20:25:060000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:25:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:27:150000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:27:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:27:150000.Dialogue: A place for fun, a place for knowledge.

00:20:33:200000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:33:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:33:200000.Dialogue: This man here is playing hackey-sack, and this girl's gonna be a paralegal.

00:20:39:110000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:39:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:39:110000.Dialogue: Oh, I get it. Because Dr. Leonard Hofstadter can't date a girl without a fancy college degree.

00:20:46:020000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:46:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:46:020000.Dialogue: It's really not that fancy. It's just a city college.

00:20:50:010000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:50:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:50:010000.Dialogue: Right, but I have to have some sort of degree to date you?

00:20:52:230000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:52:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:52:230000.Dialogue: That doesn't matter to me at all.

00:20:54:170000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:54:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:54:170000.Dialogue: So it's fine with you if I'm not smart.

00:20:57:140000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:20:57:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:21:03:220000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:21:03:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:21:03:220000.Dialogue: Okay, this time, I know where I went wrong.

00:21:09:110000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard is outside Penny’s door.
00:21:09:110000.Speaker: Leonard
